abstract: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives?
snippet: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives?
lead_paragraph: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives? You don’t have to cut and paste a thing  and you can tell Word exactly how much fake text to supply. Say you want to add four paragraphs of three sentences each. In your document, just type in “=rand(4,3)” on its own line, without the quotation marks, and press the Enter key. Word fills the space with text in the requested amount of paragraphs and sentences. The content varies with the version of Word. More details and instructions are at www.support.microsoft.com/kb/212251.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Faking Text in Word
